thread.title: Producers Lex Luger & Southside Willing To Put Up $100K In Beat Battle
thread.title_full: Producers Lex Luger & Southside Willing To Put Up $100K In Beat Battle

author: Danielle Harling
title: Producers Lex Luger & Southside Willing To Put Up $100K In Beat Battle
text:
9 
After being challenged by Virginia-born beatsmith Lex Luger , Southside is prepared to put his beats on the line for $100,000, a request Luger revealed that he is happy to oblige. 
In a video uploaded to Instagram last week, Southside informed fans that he was privately contacted by Luger about taking part in a beat battle. The producer seemed unimpressed with Luger‚Äôs initial request of $50,000 and suggested that those taking part in the battle put up $100,000 instead. 
‚ÄúSo, I wake up. I got a DM from Lex Luger talking about a beat battle with me, Metro, and Sonny,‚Äù Southside said in the video. ‚ÄúLex, this is $50,000 ‚Ä¶ Until you got a whole 100 on you you can gamble with, bro. Don‚Äôt hit me talking about no beat battle ‚Ä¶ Put a whole hundred on the table and we can beat battle.‚Äù A post shared by SOUTHSIDE (@808mafiaboss) on Mar 9, 2017 at 12:42pm PST 
Luger has since accepted Southside‚Äôs offer to battle for $100K, in a series of videos uploaded to Instagram yesterday (March 12). 
‚ÄúSizzle, call my phone. You want a beat battle? Metro? Sonny Digital? Who else? Cause we big boy pimpin‚Äô out here,‚Äù Lex Luger says as he flashes a wad of cash. üòà A post shared by Lex Luger (@lexlugertmog) on Mar 12, 2017 at 2:35pm PDT A post shared by Lex Luger (@lexlugertmog) on Mar 12, 2017 at 2:37pm PDT 
Southside further stressed his desire to battle for $100K in a tweet sent earlier today (March 13). @IamAkademiks i tell u what tell a nigga get the hunnid grand and show it to me @SmokedOutLuger and not 6k and a 2003 bens and I'm on 
‚Äî Southside (@sizzle808MAFIA) March 13, 2017 
With strong ties in the Southeast, Lex Luger, Southside, Metro Boomin , and Sonny Digital have all provided beats for a number of Southern bangers, including Waka Flocka Flame‚Äôs ‚ÄúHard In Da Paint‚Äù (Lex Luger) and Future‚Äôs ‚ÄúFuck Up Some Commas‚Äù (Southside, co-produced with DJ Spinz). 
News of a possible beat battle between the quartet comes weeks after Swizz Beatz and Just Blaze went head-to-head in a battle broadcast on Instagram Live. The epic, two-hour long beat extravaganza reached its apex when Swizz unleashed a monstrous track featuring DMX, Jadakiss, Jay Z, and Nas. 
Given the success of his battle with Just Blaze, Swizz is now attempting to orchestrate a DJ battle between New York City veterans DJ Clue and Funkmaster Flex. 
There is no word yet on whether or not Metro Boomin and Sonny Digital have agreed to take part in the beat battle with Lex Luger, or if/when Lex and Southside will make their battle official.
